column4: back to DHCP, issue persists (if you already replied, please copy-paste answer)
has your machine got an IP address from dhcp ?
won't connect at all, can't even ping
that's not what I asked, please answer the question I asked, "does your machine get an IP address from dhcp"
tried plugging in another computer and it works… :S
no ip address received
ok, please do "sudo ifconfig -a" how many devices do you see ?
eth0 + lo
run "sudo dhclient eth0"
ok. That keeps on sending a request but it does not seem to be using the right netmask
that's called a broadcast, don't worry about that
it exited with "No DHCPOFFERS received."
and "No working leases in persistent database - sleeping."
ok, so there is the issue, the dhcp sever is not giving an IP - so either a.) there is a problem with the dhcpd server b.) there is a problem with your cable
based on that error, there appears to be a problem with the range on the dhcp server

cable should be no problem since it works with other computers. As for the DHCP range… it worked before and the machine is remembered… I'm gonna try forgetting in the router configuration page to see what happens.
that would be the most reasonable action
removing the problematic machine from the DHCP client list di not help… :(
re-run sudo dhclient eth0 see if the error changed
same error
got to be a problem with the router not offering a dhcp request
shouldn't it be using the right netmask? My router's is 255.255.255.0. dhclient is using 255.255.255.255
it's not a netmask, its'a broadcast as I said earlier
